item.title: Three Common Things We Can't Do With Bitcoin Yet
item.description:
Three Common Things We Can't Do With Bitcoin Yet

Albeit there are several things one can do with Bitcoin, there are some things that are not possible yet. Depending on where one lives, the usability of Bitcoin in its purest form is relatively limited, or somewhat gaining mainstream interest. This situation might change over time, though, depending on when people start to see the value of Bitcoin.

item.title: Puerto Rico Debt Default Creates Bitcoin Opportunities
item.description:
Puerto Rico Debt Default Creates Bitcoin Opportunities

Working out a repayment plan should be the top priority for the Puerto Rican government, but that will not be the case for the foreseeable future. Puerto Rico is not often mentioned in a positive content when it comes to the financial sector. Neither is this story, unfortunately, as the country decided to default on its debt.

item.title: 'Italian Mafia Brussels' Taken Down, but Darknet Still Growing
item.description:
'Italian Mafia Brussels' Taken Down, but Darknet Still Growing

A major darknet vendor group selling MDMA and Also read: Darknet Purchases Increasing as Drug War Continues to Fail Ecstasy , calling themselves the "Italian Mafia Brussels," was recently taken down in an international police operation.

item.title: Puerto Rico Defaults on Debt: Invest in Bitcoin Instead
item.description:
Puerto Rico Defaults on Debt: Invest in Bitcoin Instead

Puerto Rico defaulted on its public debt. The US island territory failed to pay its general obligation bonds on Friday. It owes an estimated $800 million to creditors, while only retaining $350 million in cash on hand.

item.title: Worldcore Adds Bitcoin for Debit Card Top-Up via Bitpay | Finance Magnates
item.description:
Worldcore Adds Bitcoin for Debit Card Top-Up via Bitpay | Finance Magnates

Worldcore, a Czech Republic-licensed payment institution, began in June accepting bitcoin payments thanks to a partnership with BitPay. The digital banking firm will offer its over 7,000 customers the ability to use the digital currency to top up their accounts and prepaid debit cards.

item.title: What are examples of profitable blockchain companies?
item.description:
What are examples of profitable blockchain companies?

Answer: Good question, and unfortunately I only have a mediocre answer to offer: we need more time to find out. The buzzword that is blockchain has spawned plenty of projects; it's quantity, not quality at the moment. 'Blockchain' itself isn't even properly defined as a technology yet, so this re...

item.title: Another Look at Emercoin Blockchain as It Rides Higher on Microsoft Azure Release
item.description:
Another Look at Emercoin Blockchain as It Rides Higher on Microsoft Azure Release

Emercoin recorded a surge in its 24 hour trade volume, after the Emercoin Blockchain Engine was released on Microsoft's Azure platform. Working with the Azure platform enables it to be deployed using CentOS or Ubuntu in the cloud.

item.title: How does bitcoin mining get that name?
item.description:
How does bitcoin mining get that name?

Answer (1 of 2): The concept of "mining" appears in the original paper that introduced the bitcoin architecture, by the enigmatic and anonymous "Satoshi Nakamoto" [1]: > The steady addition of a constant of amount of new coins is analogous to gold miners expending resources to add gold to circu...

item.title: John McAfee to Launch Giant Bitcoin Mining Operation in the U.S | Finance Magnates
item.description:
John McAfee to Launch Giant Bitcoin Mining Operation in the U.S | Finance Magnates

It is feared by many that the utter dominance of Bitcoin mining by a handful of Chinese firms will doom the cryptocurrency. However, despite the fact that international competitors such as KnCMiner were driven to bankruptcy, a new venture dares to take on China with a facility in the US no less.
